chargeHist.descr: Deliver Methamphetamine on or near a youth center - 2nd or subsequent (<=3g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matt E. LOEWENBEIN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Methamphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with the sentences presently being served on 09 CF 48 and 09 CF 296.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search or a combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Provide DNA sample.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant from Dodge Correctional Institution for his plea and sentencing hearing set for 12/04/2015, at 1:30 p.m.
Copy filed.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing. 
Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with DA set for 10-29-2015 at 1:30 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-21-15 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody on warrant and by Attorney Ann Larson.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts deliver methamphetamine on/near youth center and deliver imitation controlled substance.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-31-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is modified to $5,000.00 cash with the conditions defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs and defendant must report daily to the Manitowoc County Jail by 4:00 p.m..  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the county jail.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail Issued.  Copy filed.

Defendant failed to appear for initial appearance.   Bench warrant authorized.  Court orders $5,000.00 cash bail to be set once defendant is taken into custody.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody on arrest warrant. The matter is continued for an initial appearance on 08-17-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, the he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs and report daily to the Manitowoc County Jail by 4:00 p.m.  Bail is furnished and the defendant is released from custody.
Arrest warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.

Warrant served.
Defendant in custody in Milwaukee County Jail.
Warrant fees of $182.34.
RE:  Deliver Methamphetamine-2nd or subsequent offense near a youth center, on 02-10-15.
